column4: Hi! I am trying to install GIMP Image Editor on my Ubuntu 11.10, but when  enter sudo apt-get install gimp, and enter my password, it runs a code line and ends with a message saying
The following packages have unmet dependencies:
gimp : Depends: libgimp2.0 (>= 2.7.5) but it is not going to be installed
Depends: libgimp2.0 (<= 2.7.5-z) but it is not going to be installed
Depends: libglib2.0-0 (>= 2.31.2) but 2.30.0-0ubuntu4 is to be installed
E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages.
why are you using the PPA
I haven't the slightest clue what PPA is
you've installed the gimp PPA to get the latest gimp version
do you have any files in /etc/apt/sources.list.d ?
open that directory and see if there is anything there
you don't know how to look at files and directories using ubuntu ?
I am new to Ubuntu, I am used to Windows' easier ways around.
the file manager is the same as windows explorer
before continuing I'd suggest having a read of https://help.ubuntu.com to get to understand the basics of how to do things like look in a directory
Oh, you could have just said to use the File Manager.:P
sort of stands to reason "look in a directory" "use the file manager"
